intro: Dendroviguiera adenophylla, commonly known as the glandular-leaved tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, glandular-dotted leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
